{"job_description": "PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Digital Product Manager - Commerce
Apply Now
Back to Search
At T-Mobile, we invest in YOU!  Our Total Rewards Package ensures that employees get the same big love we give our customers.  All team members receive a competitive base salary and compensation package - this is Total Rewards. Employees enjoy multiple wealth-building opportunities through our annual stock grant, employee stock purchase plan, 401(k), and access to free, year-round money coaches. That’s how we’re UNSTOPPABLE for our employees!

Are you excited by the opportunity to build the best digital experience as part of T-Mobile’s industry-leading transformation across apps and web? Come help us expand our impact in connecting people to their world—whether through T-Mobile postpaid, Metro by T-Mobile prepaid, or one of our other innovative brands. This is your chance to join a team of hard-working product managers who are making the impossible possible.

The Product Managers at T-Mobile are innovators, strategists, analysts, and customer evangelists who guide digital product development from conception to launch. Working in close collaboration with Engineers, Designers, Researchers, Marketers, and Business teams, the Digital Product Manager aligns priorities and drives a software development roadmap that transforms how we do business across our brands.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce, Technical is the ultimate "jack-of-all-trades" leveraging deep customer empathy, strategic thinking, commercial, analytical, technical capability and knowledge, and leadership prowess to successfully deliver delightful and differentiated products that drive growth and positively impact our customers lives across T-Mobile or Metro by T-Mobile. They are the experts at the intersection of the wireless industry and the digital world, creating experiences that are on par with the best in technology.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce is asked to lead the development and optimization of e-commerce experiences across our digital platforms - Web, T-Life, or Metro by T-Mobile prepaid. In this role, you will be responsible for defining product vision, roadmap, and feature requirements to drive online sales, enhance customer journeys, and support business growth. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams—including UX, engineering, marketing, and analytics—to deliver seamless, scalable, and innovative digital solutions. The ideal candidate has a strong background in e-commerce, data-driven decision-making, and agile product development.
Job Responsibilities:

Vision, Strategy, and Analysis
• Owns product end to end for products or features with moderate level of complexity and scope. This includes creating, managing, maintaining, and communicating product vision and roadmap including technical vision and capabilities.
• Drives end user product research.
• Partners with business and internal/external stakeholders to understand current customer experience, identifies areas of opportunity.
• Conducts analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to identify product innovation opportunities or root cause of issues, and assess opportunity size and impact. May work with data scientists to answer complex questions or identify meaningful insights from data.
• Leverages rapid hypothesis driven testing methodologies and experiments (i.e. paper prototype, A/B testing, etc.) to inform direction, prioritize investment.
• Conducts cost-benefit / ROI / NPV analysis, to support decision making.
• Develops and maintains current understanding of tech trends. Assesses how trends impact the roadmap or create opportunity for innovation of the product.
• Communicates, influences, and sells ideas at Director level and below. This includes regularly delivering product presentations.
• Conducts specific ad hoc analysis and provides insights to management on request.
• Recommends product feature set or technical improvements to improve customer experience.
Customer Evangelist
• Leverages customer insights for product vision, strategy, roadmap, priorities.
• Dedicates time to customers actively meeting with them to build deeper empathy and understand their needs
and priorities.
• Evangelizes and advocates for the customer both internally (IC through C level) and externally, perpetuating the customer-first mindset.
• Creates an environment and culture where the team is immersed in customer-first mindset.
Product Execution & Technical Delivery
• Translates product/platform strategy by writing detailed features and user stories consumable for Dev teams for moderately complex products. This work may include creation of prototypes.
• Collaborates with PM and Dev leaders to design, architect and assemble effective Agile delivery teams in the Agile Release Train and Agile Teams.
• Runs or contributes significantly to key Agile ceremonies: Program Increment (PI) Planning / Big Room Planning; System Demo; Inspect and Adapt (I&A), etc.
• Owns and manages product backlog and priorities with our business and technology partners. Backlog at this level typically serves 1 - 4 Agile / Scrum / Sprint teams.
• Scopes and prioritizes activities based on business and customer impact.
• Ensures existing production defects are factored into regular backlog prioritization for resolution based on priority.
• Collaborates with stakeholders and Dev / Execution teams to create and communicate anticipated release schedule.
• Generates and maintains dashboards and reports that track product health and success metrics, technical KPI’s.
• Communicates technical challenges to stakeholders and makes educated trade-off decisions based on those challenges.
• Accountable for product quality and performance in production environment. Accountable for product team response in event of critical or high impacting defect, including communications to stakeholders at all levels.
Relationship & People, Professional Development
• Collaborates and develops positive working relationships with many technical and non-technical teams, including sales, commercial, accounting, marketing, legal, go-to-market, finance, Dev, Architecture, Engineering. Works with outside partners and other third parties.
• Develops positive working relationships with Customer groups or Customer Representatives.
• Maintains professional knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviews professional publications; establishes personal networks; participates in professional societies.
• Develops adoption tools and training material.
• Manages development of adoption tools and training materials for Technical Product Management team. 

Education and Work Experience:

Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Marketing or equivalent experience. (Required) 
3+ years experience in hands on technical writing production code, solution engineering, or technical architecture in large scale company/ application/product environment. (Required)
5+ years of relevant Product Management experience in an agile software product development environment. (Required) 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Agile Methodologies Proven success in delivering software with Agile Scrum methodologies and other commonly used tools. (Required) 
Technical Writing Strong requirements elicitation, and proven writing skills including the ability to write concisely and clearly for different audiences. (Required) 
Agile Project Management Experience with Agile backlog/project management tools. (Required) 
Collaboration Experience with successive elaboration and ability to develop Initiatives, Features and User Stories that the DevOps teams can ingest. (Required) 
Communication Proven ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with Leadership, while employing a high degree of collaboration and influence.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences including executives and non-technical leaders. (Required) 
Business Analysis Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to identify/analyze/synthesize product use data. (Required) 

Licenses and Certifications:

Certified Scrum Master (CSM) Scrum Product Owner Certification (CSPO) (Preferred) 
Other Technical Certification Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) (Preferred)
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States

Travel:
Travel Required (Yes/No):

DOT Regulated:
DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No): No
Safety Sensitive Position (Yes/No): No

Base Pay Range: $103,400 - $186,400
Corporate Bonus Target: 15%
The pay range above is the general base pay range for a successful candidate in the role. The successful candidate’s actual pay will be based on various factors, such as work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay will vary within this range.

At T-Mobile, employees in regular, non-temporary roles are eligible for an annual bonus or periodic sales incentive or bonus, based on their role. Most Corporate employees are eligible for a year-end bonus based on company and/or individual performance and which is set at a percentage of the employee’s eligible earnings in the prior year. Certain positions in Customer Care are eligible for monthly bonuses based on individual and/or team performance. To find the pay range for this role based on hiring location, click here.
At T-Mobile, our benefits exemplify the spirit of One Team, Together! A big part of how we care for one another is working to ensure our benefits evolve to meet the needs of our team members. Full and part-time employees have access to the same benefits when eligible. We cover all of the bases, offering medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, 401(k), employee stock grants, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and up to 12 paid holidays - which total about 4 weeks for new full-time employees and about 2.5 weeks for new part-time employees annually - paid parental and family leave, family building benefits, back-up care, enhanced family support, childcare subsidy, tuition assistance, college coaching, short- and long-term disability, voluntary AD&D coverage, voluntary accident coverage, voluntary life insurance, voluntary disability insurance, and voluntary long-term care insurance. We don't stop there - eligible employees can also receive mobile service & home internet discounts, pet insurance, and access to commuter and transit programs! {"job_description": "PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Digital Product Manager - Commerce
Apply Now
Back to Search
At T-Mobile, we invest in YOU!  Our Total Rewards Package ensures that employees get the same big love we give our customers.  All team members receive a competitive base salary and compensation package - this is Total Rewards. Employees enjoy multiple wealth-building opportunities through our annual stock grant, employee stock purchase plan, 401(k), and access to free, year-round money coaches. That’s how we’re UNSTOPPABLE for our employees!

Are you excited by the opportunity to build the best digital experience as part of T-Mobile’s industry-leading transformation across apps and web? Come help us expand our impact in connecting people to their world—whether through T-Mobile postpaid, Metro by T-Mobile prepaid, or one of our other innovative brands. This is your chance to join a team of hard-working product managers who are making the impossible possible.

The Product Managers at T-Mobile are innovators, strategists, analysts, and customer evangelists who guide digital product development from conception to launch. Working in close collaboration with Engineers, Designers, Researchers, Marketers, and Business teams, the Digital Product Manager aligns priorities and drives a software development roadmap that transforms how we do business across our brands.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce, Technical is the ultimate "jack-of-all-trades" leveraging deep customer empathy, strategic thinking, commercial, analytical, technical capability and knowledge, and leadership prowess to successfully deliver delightful and differentiated products that drive growth and positively impact our customers lives across T-Mobile or Metro by T-Mobile. They are the experts at the intersection of the wireless industry and the digital world, creating experiences that are on par with the best in technology.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce is asked to lead the development and optimization of e-commerce experiences across our digital platforms - Web, T-Life, or Metro by T-Mobile prepaid. In this role, you will be responsible for defining product vision, roadmap, and feature requirements to drive online sales, enhance customer journeys, and support business growth. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams—including UX, engineering, marketing, and analytics—to deliver seamless, scalable, and innovative digital solutions. The ideal candidate has a strong background in e-commerce, data-driven decision-making, and agile product development.
Job Responsibilities:

Vision, Strategy, and Analysis
• Owns product end to end for products or features with moderate level of complexity and scope. This includes creating, managing, maintaining, and communicating product vision and roadmap including technical vision and capabilities.
• Drives end user product research.
• Partners with business and internal/external stakeholders to understand current customer experience, identifies areas of opportunity.
• Conducts analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to identify product innovation opportunities or root cause of issues, and assess opportunity size and impact. May work with data scientists to answer complex questions or identify meaningful insights from data.
• Leverages rapid hypothesis driven testing methodologies and experiments (i.e. paper prototype, A/B testing, etc.) to inform direction, prioritize investment.
• Conducts cost-benefit / ROI / NPV analysis, to support decision making.
• Develops and maintains current understanding of tech trends. Assesses how trends impact the roadmap or create opportunity for innovation of the product.
• Communicates, influences, and sells ideas at Director level and below. This includes regularly delivering product presentations.
• Conducts specific ad hoc analysis and provides insights to management on request.
• Recommends product feature set or technical improvements to improve customer experience.
Customer Evangelist
• Leverages customer insights for product vision, strategy, roadmap, priorities.
• Dedicates time to customers actively meeting with them to build deeper empathy and understand their needs
and priorities.
• Evangelizes and advocates for the customer both internally (IC through C level) and externally, perpetuating the customer-first mindset.
• Creates an environment and culture where the team is immersed in customer-first mindset.
Product Execution & Technical Delivery
• Translates product/platform strategy by writing detailed features and user stories consumable for Dev teams for moderately complex products. This work may include creation of prototypes.
• Collaborates with PM and Dev leaders to design, architect and assemble effective Agile delivery teams in the Agile Release Train and Agile Teams.
• Runs or contributes significantly to key Agile ceremonies: Program Increment (PI) Planning / Big Room Planning; System Demo; Inspect and Adapt (I&A), etc.
• Owns and manages product backlog and priorities with our business and technology partners. Backlog at this level typically serves 1 - 4 Agile / Scrum / Sprint teams.
• Scopes and prioritizes activities based on business and customer impact.
• Ensures existing production defects are factored into regular backlog prioritization for resolution based on priority.
• Collaborates with stakeholders and Dev / Execution teams to create and communicate anticipated release schedule.
• Generates and maintains dashboards and reports that track product health and success metrics, technical KPI’s.
• Communicates technical challenges to stakeholders and makes educated trade-off decisions based on those challenges.
• Accountable for product quality and performance in production environment. Accountable for product team response in event of critical or high impacting defect, including communications to stakeholders at all levels.
Relationship & People, Professional Development
• Collaborates and develops positive working relationships with many technical and non-technical teams, including sales, commercial, accounting, marketing, legal, go-to-market, finance, Dev, Architecture, Engineering. Works with outside partners and other third parties.
• Develops positive working relationships with Customer groups or Customer Representatives.
• Maintains professional knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviews professional publications; establishes personal networks; participates in professional societies.
• Develops adoption tools and training material.
• Manages development of adoption tools and training materials for Technical Product Management team. 

Education and Work Experience:

Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Marketing or equivalent experience. (Required) 
3+ years experience in hands on technical writing production code, solution engineering, or technical architecture in large scale company/ application/product environment. (Required)
5+ years of relevant Product Management experience in an agile software product development environment. (Required) 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Agile Methodologies Proven success in delivering software with Agile Scrum methodologies and other commonly used tools. (Required) 
Technical Writing Strong requirements elicitation, and proven writing skills including the ability to write concisely and clearly for different audiences. (Required) 
Agile Project Management Experience with Agile backlog/project management tools. (Required) 
Collaboration Experience with successive elaboration and ability to develop Initiatives, Features and User Stories that the DevOps teams can ingest. (Required) 
Communication Proven ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with Leadership, while employing a high degree of collaboration and influence.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences including executives and non-technical leaders. (Required) 
Business Analysis Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to identify/analyze/synthesize product use data. (Required) 

Licenses and Certifications:

Certified Scrum Master (CSM) Scrum Product Owner Certification (CSPO) (Preferred) 
Other Technical Certification Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) (Preferred)
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States

Travel:
Travel Required (Yes/No):

DOT Regulated:
DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No): No
Safety Sensitive Position (Yes/No): No

Base Pay Range: $103,400 - $186,400
Corporate Bonus Target: 15%
The pay range above is the general base pay range for a successful candidate in the role. The successful candidate’s actual pay will be based on various factors, such as work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay will vary within this range.

At T-Mobile, employees in regular, non-temporary roles are eligible for an annual bonus or periodic sales incentive or bonus, based on their role. Most Corporate employees are eligible for a year-end bonus based on company and/or individual performance and which is set at a percentage of the employee’s eligible earnings in the prior year. Certain positions in Customer Care are eligible for monthly bonuses based on individual and/or team performance. To find the pay range for this role based on hiring location, click here.
At T-Mobile, our benefits exemplify the spirit of One Team, Together! A big part of how we care for one another is working to ensure our benefits evolve to meet the needs of our team members. Full and part-time employees have access to the same benefits when eligible. We cover all of the bases, offering medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, 401(k), employee stock grants, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and up to 12 paid holidays - which total about 4 weeks for new full-time employees and about 2.5 weeks for new part-time employees annually - paid parental and family leave, family building benefits, back-up care, enhanced family support, childcare subsidy, tuition assistance, college coaching, short- and long-term disability, voluntary AD&D coverage, voluntary accident coverage, voluntary life insurance, voluntary disability insurance, and voluntary long-term care insurance. We don't stop there - eligible employees can also receive mobile service & home internet discounts, pet insurance, and access to commuter and transit programs! To learn about T-Mobile’s amazing benefits, check out www.t-mobilebenefits.com.", "job_metadata": {"job_url": "https://careers.t-mobile.com/digital-product-manager-commerce/job/489E5F81C57507BC69607931D1155B56"}, "resume_content": null, "analyzed_requirements": null, "resume_sections": null, "validation_result": null, "generated_doc_path": "", "resume_url": "", "retry_count": 0, "error_message": "", "status": "processing"}

{"resume_content": "﻿Company: Leaficient. (Pittsburgh, PA) Role: Machine Learning Engineer. Duration(Apr 2024 - Present)
Machine Learning Models Related work at Leaficient:
* Designed and deployed ML models for image understanding with PyTorch, leveraging vision-language models and image generation to improve segmentation accuracy by 20%. 
* Created custom tracking algorithms on time-series plant data using LSTMs and embedding-based methods to model growth and predict yield over time, improving yield estimation accuracy by 50%.


ML in Production Related work at Leaficient:
* Established ML engineering best practices by containerizing (Docker, AWS EKS, Kubernetes), achieving 30% latency reduction. Built robust systems supporting reproducible experimentation and rapid iteration without compromising quality.
* Built automated MLOps model evaluation pipeline that flagged segmentation regressions in new images, using entropy, and ground truth data. Explored JAX for transformer prototyping and efficient training with XLA.
* Productionized a Python/PyTorch data-generation service (Docker, AWS Lambda/S3/EC2) with dataset versioning powering training/eval for segmentation models, shrinking time-to-add a new failure mode from months to days.
* Optimized distributed pipelines on AWS (Lambda, S3, EC2) for cost and latency, batching inference and reducing per-image processing time by ~30%; deployed segmentation and health models across 20+ greenhouses with monitoring and on-call runbooks to sustain ~99.5% uptime.
* Optimized container runtimes for GPU and serverless inference (Docker + AWS Lambda), tuning memory and execution constraints for hardware-aware ML workloads.




Datasets related work at Leaficient: 
* Cultivated datasets of 10,000+ RGB images across multiple farms and 200+ self-collected hyperspectral scans, labeling hundreds of data points; designed augmentation strategies to handle variable lighting and environments.
* Built a data-gen + curation stack (DINO/SAM for triage, PyTorch augmentation, dataset versioning) over 10k+ RGB and 200+ hyperspectral scans; FP −20% on new facilities.




Generative AI Related work at Leaficient:
* Built data augmentation pipeline using PyTorch and scikit-learn, generating synthetic training variants that improved model recall by 50% in production. Addressed distribution shift and data scarcity through systematic augmentation strategies. 
* Applied diffusion and transformer-backed inpainting methods to recover occluded plant imagery, improving segmentation robustness in the downstream pipeline under real-world constraints by 20%.
* Generated synthetic data variants (exposure, glare, color temperature, LED flicker) to augment scarce data lowering false negatives by 50% across new facilities.






LLM Agent Related work at Leaficient:
* Shipped a LangGraph multi-agent analytics platform (6 sub-agents + orchestrator) that turned ad-hoc grower questions into SQL, charts, and narratives; cut turnaround from days to <5 min across 10k+ images & millions of sensor points for 20+ B2B growers.

* Built eval + safety harness (Guardrails, MLflow), retrieval via LlamaIndex, and standardized tools via MCP; added prompt versioning and HIL loops to reduce error rates release-over-release.

*    * Built user-facing LLM-based agent system with LangGraph (6 sub-agents + orchestrator) to query database, generate graphs and visualizations, and interface with 10k+ datapoints across sensors and images;. long-horizon task execution for SQL generation, database queries, visualization generation, and insight synthesis. Applied tool use, systematic prompt engineering, and human-in-the-loop.
   * Designed prompt pipelines and evaluations to ensure reliable outputs. Used MLflow
   * Implemented agent design patterns with observability, debugging workflows and validation (Guardrails AI). Integrated LlamaIndex for retrieval and MCP (Model Context Protocol) for standardized tooling.
   * Architected and deployed a production LLM agent system that automated complex analytics workflows, reducing query response time from multiple days to <5 minutes for B2B customers handling 10K+ data points per query.
   * Established prompt engineering practices including versioning, and iterative refinement based on user feedback. Implemented dynamic prompt adaptation based on user state and query types, following LLM best practices to optimize accuracy and response quality across diverse use cases.


Computer Vision Related work:
   * Implemented 3D computer vision models in PyTorch for geometry from monocular images, reducing prediction error by 8%. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, and inference latency to optimize deployment.


Research Related work at Leaficient:
   * Implemented peer-reviewed methods for hyperspectral imaging and noise reduction to improve signal quality and non-destructive plant health assessment. Created a custom analysis pipeline to detect anomalies in spectral data, using unsupervised learning and physics based techniques.
   * Engineered hyperspectral imaging system (VNIR, 150+ bands) for non-invasive photosynthetic health analytics
   * Experimented with single-image 3D estimation for plant geometry when LiDAR was not viable, reducing yield MAE by 8% vs. 2D baseline.




Hardware:
   * Developed Raspberry Pi–based hardware for greenhouse deployment; improved device uptime by 95% integrated PAR & VPD sensors to improve environmental data collection.


Software Engineering Backend related work at Leaficient:
   * Built and maintained a full-stack web application (React + Next.js frontend; Django microservices with AWS Lambda + EC2 + SQS backend; SQL + DynamoDB storage, Flask) processing 10k+ images and millions of time-series data points, powering real-time analytics dashboards for 20 B2B customers.
   * Designed and optimized complex SQL queries on multi-table datasets (10k+ images, millions of time-series readings); introduced indexing, caching, and query-plan tuning that improved performance by 200% for live dashboards.
   * Introduced observability with logging, metrics, and alerting that cut mean time to recovery <24h; integrated CI/CD workflows to ensure high test coverage and reliable deployments.


Product Management related work at Leaficient:
   * Engaged directly with B2B customers in weekly meetings to understand business requirements, troubleshoot issues, and translate operational needs into technical solutions.
   * Owned architectural tradeoffs for ML inference pipelines, containerizing workloads with Docker + EKS (Kubernetes) to reduce latency ~30% and compute cost, balancing scalability vs. cost.
   * Acted as trusted advisor to enterprise clients, leading workshops and code-with sessions to define use cases, rapidly prototype, and operationalize agentic workflows aligned with business needs.
   * Acted as product owner for Leaficient’s AI platform, sequenced a roadmap that delivered quick wins while de-risking larger bets, created dashboards for 20+ B2B growers and internal users. 
   * Translated field challenges into ML product requirements and delivered solutions such as image inpainting, and VLMs to recover occlusions in plant imagery, improving segmentation robustness by 20% under real-world conditions.
   * Defined and delivered an LLM agent platform (LangGraph with 6 sub-agents + orchestrator) enabling non-technical users to analyze multimodal data (10k+ images, millions of sensor readings) and generate insights without analyst support.
   * Balanced technical tradeoffs vs. business goals by containerizing ML inference pipelines (Docker + EKS), cutting latency ~30% and compute costs while scaling workloads reliably.
   * Authored detailed user stories (business rationale, acceptance criteria, analytics success measures) and coordinated Agile rituals with engineers to deliver iterative releases.


Department of Human Services        Pittsburgh PA Data Scientist Intern        Jun 2023 - Aug 2023
   * Developed ranking and recommendation system for resource allocation across 100k+ high-dimensional individuals. Implemented learning-to-rank models that improved NDCG@K by 8% over baseline, optimizing model performance through feature engineering and hyperparameter tuning. 
   * Built interpretable ML models achieving 20% AUC improvement. Evaluated fairness metrics using statistical analysis and visualization, explaining model decisions to non-technical stakeholders to ensure adoption.
   * Prototyped a RAG-based agent to query 100k+ sensitive personal data from DHS programs; automated SQL lookups, cutting manual analyst effort by hours per week.
   * Trained interpretable models (R, Python) to support fair and privacy-preserving decision-making; presented results to policy stakeholders, highlighting how statistical rigor reduced racial bias in sensitive human services datasets.




   * Sole PM and founding team member for developer onboarding product (DevPath), shaping roadmap from 0→1 and scaling adoption across 200+ enterprise customers (Microsoft, T-Mobile, Groupon, etc.).
   * Sequenced near-term enablers (infrastructure, authentication, GDPR compliance) ahead of higher-risk efforts; reduced platform risk while ensuring long-term scalability. Directly transferable to HIPAA and healthcare regulatory requirements.
   * Acted as technical decision-maker on infrastructure projects, balancing developer velocity with system scalability, and delivery of features. Planned sprints on JIRA; used agile methodologies.
   * Aligned business owners and engineering on shared product vision and prioritization frameworks. Ran A/B testing to validate changes before release.




Educative        Lahore, Pakistan Technical Product Manager        Oct 2020 - Dec 2022 


   * Led research and development of personalized feed recommendation engine for digital courses marketplace (1.5M+ users), collaborating with engineers on hybrid ranking algorithms. Applied data-driven experimentation and evaluation to improve CTR by ~10%.
   * Partnered with cross-functional stakeholders to define enterprise AI architectures for compliance (GDPR), balancing security, scalability, and modularity—directly applicable to agentic AI deployments in regulated industries (finance, healthcare).
   * Analyzed 10M+ monthly user interaction events (200 interactions/session × 50k monthly users) in BigQuery to track subscription usage per user.


   * Engaged with cross-functional stakeholders (engineering, legal, executive leadership) to define technical requirements for GDPR compliance. Made architectural tradeoff decisions balancing security, scalability, and developer velocity—directly applicable to enterprise AI deployments in regulated industries (healthcare, finance)


   * Acted as technical decision-maker on infrastructure projects, balancing developer velocity with system scalability, and delivery of features.
   * Led infrastructure team, and authentication team to deliver GDPR compliance by implementing data security and retention rules. Established privacy-by-design practices directly transferable to HIPAA healthcare data requirements.
   * Led development of ML-powered recommendation and ranking system serving 1.5M+ users, collaborating with engineers to design hybrid algorithms that improved CTR by 10%. 
   * Performed A/B testing, offline evaluation, and iterative model refinement to balance recommendation quality with system latency. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, serving latency, and recommendation quality. Iterated rapidly on ranking features and model architectures without compromising production stability.
   * Mentored junior engineers through code reviews, pull requests, documentation and pair programming.
   * Led the infrastructure team, reduced page load times by 5% through React code-splitting and bundling optimizations, improving user experience for millions of learners.
   * Investigated and resolved cold-start latency issues in GCP cloud instances, improving responsiveness for affected users by 60 seconds.
Educative Software Engineer        Jun 2018 - Sep 2020 
   * Rebuilt backend search & discovery pipeline from basic text-matching to Google’s search infrastructure, enriching results with metadata and improving relevance. Reduced page drop-off by 40%, driving higher content discovery and user retention.
   * Partnered with designers and growers to translate UX wireframes into production-ready React/Next.js interfaces; iterated on user feedback to improve navigation and usability in analytics dashboards.
   * Scaled subscription services from hundreds to millions of users, implementing payment workflows (subscription tiers ~$5k–10k enterprise, B2C monthly SaaS) and monitoring usage analytics to drive pricing strategy.
   * Engineered APIs and delivery pipelines for interactive content delivery, ensuring seamless content delivery to 2M+ learners globally.
   * Overhauled frontend with React and modern state management, optimized backend queries, and built UI/UX for user onboarding flows, to scale weekly active users from 1000s to 10,000s
   * Established production-grade observability infrastructure (logging, metrics, alerting) and debugging workflows that reduced MTTR to <24h. Integrated CI/CD pipelines with automated evaluation to ensure reliable, enterprise-grade deployments








SKILLS:
Product Management: Roadmap development (short- & long-term); user story writing (business rationale,
measurable outcomes); Agile/Scrum rituals; stakeholder management; metrics-driven iteration;
cross-functional collaboration with engineering & leadership, JIRA, Sprint planning, prioritization frameworks.
AI/ML: Model training, deployment, monitoring, observability, reliability; MLOps (Docker, AWS Lambda,
CI/CD), LangGraph, RAG workflows; prompt engineering.
Data Science:
Statistical modeling (Logistic Regression, XGBoost, LambdaMART); hypothesis testing & A/B experimentation;
time-series forecasting, BigQuery, SQL.
Cloud:
AWS (S3, Lambda, ECS, EKS, CloudWatch), Kubernetes, Docker, REST APIs; observability/metrics dashboards;
data privacy & GDPR/PII compliance (HIPAA-transferable practices).
Professional Skills:
User research & requirements gathering; solution design under constraints; technical writing; translating
technical platform value for diverse stakeholders; mentoring engineers.", "status": "pointers_loaded"}

{"job_description": "PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Digital Product Manager - Commerce
Apply Now
Back to Search
At T-Mobile, we invest in YOU!  Our Total Rewards Package ensures that employees get the same big love we give our customers.  All team members receive a competitive base salary and compensation package - this is Total Rewards. Employees enjoy multiple wealth-building opportunities through our annual stock grant, employee stock purchase plan, 401(k), and access to free, year-round money coaches. That’s how we’re UNSTOPPABLE for our employees!

Are you excited by the opportunity to build the best digital experience as part of T-Mobile’s industry-leading transformation across apps and web? Come help us expand our impact in connecting people to their world—whether through T-Mobile postpaid, Metro by T-Mobile prepaid, or one of our other innovative brands. This is your chance to join a team of hard-working product managers who are making the impossible possible.

The Product Managers at T-Mobile are innovators, strategists, analysts, and customer evangelists who guide digital product development from conception to launch. Working in close collaboration with Engineers, Designers, Researchers, Marketers, and Business teams, the Digital Product Manager aligns priorities and drives a software development roadmap that transforms how we do business across our brands.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce, Technical is the ultimate "jack-of-all-trades" leveraging deep customer empathy, strategic thinking, commercial, analytical, technical capability and knowledge, and leadership prowess to successfully deliver delightful and differentiated products that drive growth and positively impact our customers lives across T-Mobile or Metro by T-Mobile. They are the experts at the intersection of the wireless industry and the digital world, creating experiences that are on par with the best in technology.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce is asked to lead the development and optimization of e-commerce experiences across our digital platforms - Web, T-Life, or Metro by T-Mobile prepaid. In this role, you will be responsible for defining product vision, roadmap, and feature requirements to drive online sales, enhance customer journeys, and support business growth. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams—including UX, engineering, marketing, and analytics—to deliver seamless, scalable, and innovative digital solutions. The ideal candidate has a strong background in e-commerce, data-driven decision-making, and agile product development.
Job Responsibilities:

Vision, Strategy, and Analysis
• Owns product end to end for products or features with moderate level of complexity and scope. This includes creating, managing, maintaining, and communicating product vision and roadmap including technical vision and capabilities.
• Drives end user product research.
• Partners with business and internal/external stakeholders to understand current customer experience, identifies areas of opportunity.
• Conducts analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to identify product innovation opportunities or root cause of issues, and assess opportunity size and impact. May work with data scientists to answer complex questions or identify meaningful insights from data.
• Leverages rapid hypothesis driven testing methodologies and experiments (i.e. paper prototype, A/B testing, etc.) to inform direction, prioritize investment.
• Conducts cost-benefit / ROI / NPV analysis, to support decision making.
• Develops and maintains current understanding of tech trends. Assesses how trends impact the roadmap or create opportunity for innovation of the product.
• Communicates, influences, and sells ideas at Director level and below. This includes regularly delivering product presentations.
• Conducts specific ad hoc analysis and provides insights to management on request.
• Recommends product feature set or technical improvements to improve customer experience.
Customer Evangelist
• Leverages customer insights for product vision, strategy, roadmap, priorities.
• Dedicates time to customers actively meeting with them to build deeper empathy and understand their needs
and priorities.
• Evangelizes and advocates for the customer both internally (IC through C level) and externally, perpetuating the customer-first mindset.
• Creates an environment and culture where the team is immersed in customer-first mindset.
Product Execution & Technical Delivery
• Translates product/platform strategy by writing detailed features and user stories consumable for Dev teams for moderately complex products. This work may include creation of prototypes.
• Collaborates with PM and Dev leaders to design, architect and assemble effective Agile delivery teams in the Agile Release Train and Agile Teams.
• Runs or contributes significantly to key Agile ceremonies: Program Increment (PI) Planning / Big Room Planning; System Demo; Inspect and Adapt (I&A), etc.
• Owns and manages product backlog and priorities with our business and technology partners. Backlog at this level typically serves 1 - 4 Agile / Scrum / Sprint teams.
• Scopes and prioritizes activities based on business and customer impact.
• Ensures existing production defects are factored into regular backlog prioritization for resolution based on priority.
• Collaborates with stakeholders and Dev / Execution teams to create and communicate anticipated release schedule.
• Generates and maintains dashboards and reports that track product health and success metrics, technical KPI’s.
• Communicates technical challenges to stakeholders and makes educated trade-off decisions based on those challenges.
• Accountable for product quality and performance in production environment. Accountable for product team response in event of critical or high impacting defect, including communications to stakeholders at all levels.
Relationship & People, Professional Development
• Collaborates and develops positive working relationships with many technical and non-technical teams, including sales, commercial, accounting, marketing, legal, go-to-market, finance, Dev, Architecture, Engineering. Works with outside partners and other third parties.
• Develops positive working relationships with Customer groups or Customer Representatives.
• Maintains professional knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviews professional publications; establishes personal networks; participates in professional societies.
• Develops adoption tools and training material.
• Manages development of adoption tools and training materials for Technical Product Management team. 

Education and Work Experience:

Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Marketing or equivalent experience. (Required) 
3+ years experience in hands on technical writing production code, solution engineering, or technical architecture in large scale company/ application/product environment. (Required)
5+ years of relevant Product Management experience in an agile software product development environment. (Required) 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Agile Methodologies Proven success in delivering software with Agile Scrum methodologies and other commonly used tools. (Required) 
Technical Writing Strong requirements elicitation, and proven writing skills including the ability to write concisely and clearly for different audiences. (Required) 
Agile Project Management Experience with Agile backlog/project management tools. (Required) 
Collaboration Experience with successive elaboration and ability to develop Initiatives, Features and User Stories that the DevOps teams can ingest. (Required) 
Communication Proven ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with Leadership, while employing a high degree of collaboration and influence.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences including executives and non-technical leaders. (Required) 
Business Analysis Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to identify/analyze/synthesize product use data. (Required) 

Licenses and Certifications:

Certified Scrum Master (CSM) Scrum Product Owner Certification (CSPO) (Preferred) 
Other Technical Certification Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) (Preferred)
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States

Travel:
Travel Required (Yes/No):

DOT Regulated:
DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No): No
Safety Sensitive Position (Yes/No): No

Base Pay Range: $103,400 - $186,400
Corporate Bonus Target: 15%
The pay range above is the general base pay range for a successful candidate in the role. The successful candidate’s actual pay will be based on various factors, such as work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay will vary within this range.

At T-Mobile, employees in regular, non-temporary roles are eligible for an annual bonus or periodic sales incentive or bonus, based on their role. Most Corporate employees are eligible for a year-end bonus based on company and/or individual performance and which is set at a percentage of the employee’s eligible earnings in the prior year. Certain positions in Customer Care are eligible for monthly bonuses based on individual and/or team performance. To find the pay range for this role based on hiring location, click here.
At T-Mobile, our benefits exemplify the spirit of One Team, Together! A big part of how we care for one another is working to ensure our benefits evolve to meet the needs of our team members. Full and part-time employees have access to the same benefits when eligible. We cover all of the bases, offering medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, 401(k), employee stock grants, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and up to 12 paid holidays - which total about 4 weeks for new full-time employees and about 2.5 weeks for new part-time employees annually - paid parental and family leave, family building benefits, back-up care, enhanced family support, childcare subsidy, tuition assistance, college coaching, short- and long-term disability, voluntary AD&D coverage, voluntary accident coverage, voluntary life insurance, voluntary disability insurance, and voluntary long-term care insurance. We don't stop there - eligible employees can also receive mobile service & home internet discounts, pet insurance, and access to commuter and transit programs! To learn about T-Mobile’s amazing benefits, check out www.t-mobilebenefits.com.", "job_metadata": {"job_url": "https://careers.t-mobile.com/digital-product-manager-commerce/job/489E5F81C57507BC69607931D1155B56"}, "resume_content": null, "analyzed_requirements": null, "resume_sections": null, "validation_result": null, "generated_doc_path": "", "resume_url": "", "retry_count": 0, "error_message": "", "status": "processing"}

   * Acted as technical decision-maker on infrastructure projects, balancing developer velocity with system scalability, and delivery of features.
   * Led infrastructure team, and authentication team to deliver GDPR compliance by implementing data security and retention rules. Established privacy-by-design practices directly transferable to HIPAA healthcare data requirements.
   * Led development of ML-powered recommendation and ranking system serving 1.5M+ users, collaborating with engineers to design hybrid algorithms that improved CTR by 10%. 
   * Performed A/B testing, offline evaluation, and iterative model refinement to balance recommendation quality with system latency. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, serving latency, and recommendation quality. Iterated rapidly on ranking features and model architectures without compromising production stability.
   * Mentored junior engineers through code reviews, pull requests, documentation and pair programming.
   * Led the infrastructure team, reduced page load times by 5% through React code-splitting and bundling optimizations, improving user experience for millions of learners.
   * Investigated and resolved cold-start latency issues in GCP cloud instances, improving responsiveness for affected users by 60 seconds.
Educative Software Engineer        Jun 2018 - Sep 2020 
   * Rebuilt backend search & discovery pipeline from basic text-matching to Google’s search infrastructure, enriching results with metadata and improving relevance. Reduced page drop-off by 40%, driving higher content discovery and user retention.
   * Partnered with designers and growers to translate UX wireframes into production-ready React/Next.js interfaces; iterated on user feedback to improve navigation and usability in analytics dashboards.
   * Scaled subscription services from hundreds to millions of users, implementing payment workflows (subscription tiers ~$5k–10k enterprise, B2C monthly SaaS) and monitoring usage analytics to drive pricing strategy.
   * Engineered APIs and delivery pipelines for interactive content delivery, ensuring seamless content delivery to 2M+ learners globally.
   * Overhauled frontend with React and modern state management, optimized backend queries, and built UI/UX for user onboarding flows, to scale weekly active users from 1000s to 10,000s
   * Established production-grade observability infrastructure (logging, metrics, alerting) and debugging workflows that reduced MTTR to <24h. Integrated CI/CD pipelines with automated evaluation to ensure reliable, enterprise-grade deployments








SKILLS:
Product Management: Roadmap development (short- & long-term); user story writing (business rationale,
measurable outcomes); Agile/Scrum rituals; stakeholder management; metrics-driven iteration;
cross-functional collaboration with engineering & leadership, JIRA, Sprint planning, prioritization frameworks.
AI/ML: Model training, deployment, monitoring, observability, reliability; MLOps (Docker, AWS Lambda,
CI/CD), LangGraph, RAG workflows; prompt engineering.
Data Science:
Statistical modeling (Logistic Regression, XGBoost, LambdaMART); hypothesis testing & A/B experimentation;
time-series forecasting, BigQuery, SQL.
Cloud:
AWS (S3, Lambda, ECS, EKS, CloudWatch), Kubernetes, Docker, REST APIs; observability/metrics dashboards;
data privacy & GDPR/PII compliance (HIPAA-transferable practices).
Professional Skills:
User research & requirements gathering; solution design under constraints; technical writing; translating
technical platform value for diverse stakeholders; mentoring engineers.", "status": "pointers_loaded"}

{"resume_content": "﻿Company: Leaficient. (Pittsburgh, PA) Role: Machine Learning Engineer. Duration(Apr 2024 - Present)
Machine Learning Models Related work at Leaficient:
* Designed and deployed ML models for image understanding with PyTorch, leveraging vision-language models and image generation to improve segmentation accuracy by 20%. 
* Created custom tracking algorithms on time-series plant data using LSTMs and embedding-based methods to model growth and predict yield over time, improving yield estimation accuracy by 50%.


ML in Production Related work at Leaficient:
* Established ML engineering best practices by containerizing (Docker, AWS EKS, Kubernetes), achieving 30% latency reduction. Built robust systems supporting reproducible experimentation and rapid iteration without compromising quality.
* Built automated MLOps model evaluation pipeline that flagged segmentation regressions in new images, using entropy, and ground truth data. Explored JAX for transformer prototyping and efficient training with XLA.
* Productionized a Python/PyTorch data-generation service (Docker, AWS Lambda/S3/EC2) with dataset versioning powering training/eval for segmentation models, shrinking time-to-add a new failure mode from months to days.
* Optimized distributed pipelines on AWS (Lambda, S3, EC2) for cost and latency, batching inference and reducing per-image processing time by ~30%; deployed segmentation and health models across 20+ greenhouses with monitoring and on-call runbooks to sustain ~99.5% uptime.
* Optimized container runtimes for GPU and serverless inference (Docker + AWS Lambda), tuning memory and execution constraints for hardware-aware ML workloads.




Datasets related work at Leaficient: 
* Cultivated datasets of 10,000+ RGB images across multiple farms and 200+ self-collected hyperspectral scans, labeling hundreds of data points; designed augmentation strategies to handle variable lighting and environments.
* Built a data-gen + curation stack (DINO/SAM for triage, PyTorch augmentation, dataset versioning) over 10k+ RGB and 200+ hyperspectral scans; FP −20% on new facilities.




Generative AI Related work at Leaficient:
* Built data augmentation pipeline using PyTorch and scikit-learn, generating synthetic training variants that improved model recall by 50% in production. Addressed distribution shift and data scarcity through systematic augmentation strategies. 
* Applied diffusion and transformer-backed inpainting methods to recover occluded plant imagery, improving segmentation robustness in the downstream pipeline under real-world constraints by 20%.
* Generated synthetic data variants (exposure, glare, color temperature, LED flicker) to augment scarce data lowering false negatives by 50% across new facilities.






LLM Agent Related work at Leaficient:
* Shipped a LangGraph multi-agent analytics platform (6 sub-agents + orchestrator) that turned ad-hoc grower questions into SQL, charts, and narratives; cut turnaround from days to <5 min across 10k+ images & millions of sensor points for 20+ B2B growers.

* Built eval + safety harness (Guardrails, MLflow), retrieval via LlamaIndex, and standardized tools via MCP; added prompt versioning and HIL loops to reduce error rates release-over-release.

*    * Built user-facing LLM-based agent system with LangGraph (6 sub-agents + orchestrator) to query database, generate graphs and visualizations, and interface with 10k+ datapoints across sensors and images;. long-horizon task execution for SQL generation, database queries, visualization generation, and insight synthesis. Applied tool use, systematic prompt engineering, and human-in-the-loop.
   * Designed prompt pipelines and evaluations to ensure reliable outputs. Used MLflow
   * Implemented agent design patterns with observability, debugging workflows and validation (Guardrails AI). Integrated LlamaIndex for retrieval and MCP (Model Context Protocol) for standardized tooling.
   * Architected and deployed a production LLM agent system that automated complex analytics workflows, reducing query response time from multiple days to <5 minutes for B2B customers handling 10K+ data points per query.
   * Established prompt engineering practices including versioning, and iterative refinement based on user feedback. Implemented dynamic prompt adaptation based on user state and query types, following LLM best practices to optimize accuracy and response quality across diverse use cases.


Computer Vision Related work:
   * Implemented 3D computer vision models in PyTorch for geometry from monocular images, reducing prediction error by 8%. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, and inference latency to optimize deployment.


Research Related work at Leaficient:
   * Implemented peer-reviewed methods for hyperspectral imaging and noise reduction to improve signal quality and non-destructive plant health assessment. Created a custom analysis pipeline to detect anomalies in spectral data, using unsupervised learning and physics based techniques.
   * Engineered hyperspectral imaging system (VNIR, 150+ bands) for non-invasive photosynthetic health analytics
   * Experimented with single-image 3D estimation for plant geometry when LiDAR was not viable, reducing yield MAE by 8% vs. 2D baseline.




Hardware:
   * Developed Raspberry Pi–based hardware for greenhouse deployment; improved device uptime by 95% integrated PAR & VPD sensors to improve environmental data collection.


Software Engineering Backend related work at Leaficient:
   * Built and maintained a full-stack web application (React + Next.js frontend; Django microservices with AWS Lambda + EC2 + SQS backend; SQL + DynamoDB storage, Flask) processing 10k+ images and millions of time-series data points, powering real-time analytics dashboards for 20 B2B customers.
   * Designed and optimized complex SQL queries on multi-table datasets (10k+ images, millions of time-series readings); introduced indexing, caching, and query-plan tuning that improved performance by 200% for live dashboards.
   * Introduced observability with logging, metrics, and alerting that cut mean time to recovery <24h; integrated CI/CD workflows to ensure high test coverage and reliable deployments.


Product Management related work at Leaficient:
   * Engaged directly with B2B customers in weekly meetings to understand business requirements, troubleshoot issues, and translate operational needs into technical solutions.
   * Owned architectural tradeoffs for ML inference pipelines, containerizing workloads with Docker + EKS (Kubernetes) to reduce latency ~30% and compute cost, balancing scalability vs. cost.
   * Acted as trusted advisor to enterprise clients, leading workshops and code-with sessions to define use cases, rapidly prototype, and operationalize agentic workflows aligned with business needs.
   * Acted as product owner for Leaficient’s AI platform, sequenced a roadmap that delivered quick wins while de-risking larger bets, created dashboards for 20+ B2B growers and internal users. 
   * Translated field challenges into ML product requirements and delivered solutions such as image inpainting, and VLMs to recover occlusions in plant imagery, improving segmentation robustness by 20% under real-world conditions.
   * Defined and delivered an LLM agent platform (LangGraph with 6 sub-agents + orchestrator) enabling non-technical users to analyze multimodal data (10k+ images, millions of sensor readings) and generate insights without analyst support.
   * Balanced technical tradeoffs vs. business goals by containerizing ML inference pipelines (Docker + EKS), cutting latency ~30% and compute costs while scaling workloads reliably.
   * Authored detailed user stories (business rationale, acceptance criteria, analytics success measures) and coordinated Agile rituals with engineers to deliver iterative releases.


Department of Human Services        Pittsburgh PA Data Scientist Intern        Jun 2023 - Aug 2023
   * Developed ranking and recommendation system for resource allocation across 100k+ high-dimensional individuals. Implemented learning-to-rank models that improved NDCG@K by 8% over baseline, optimizing model performance through feature engineering and hyperparameter tuning. 
   * Built interpretable ML models achieving 20% AUC improvement. Evaluated fairness metrics using statistical analysis and visualization, explaining model decisions to non-technical stakeholders to ensure adoption.

Digital Product Manager - Commerce
Apply Now
Back to Search
At T-Mobile, we invest in YOU!  Our Total Rewards Package ensures that employees get the same big love we give our customers.  All team members receive a competitive base salary and compensation package - this is Total Rewards. Employees enjoy multiple wealth-building opportunities through our annual stock grant, employee stock purchase plan, 401(k), and access to free, year-round money coaches. That’s how we’re UNSTOPPABLE for our employees!

Are you excited by the opportunity to build the best digital experience as part of T-Mobile’s industry-leading transformation across apps and web? Come help us expand our impact in connecting people to their world—whether through T-Mobile postpaid, Metro by T-Mobile prepaid, or one of our other innovative brands. This is your chance to join a team of hard-working product managers who are making the impossible possible.

The Product Managers at T-Mobile are innovators, strategists, analysts, and customer evangelists who guide digital product development from conception to launch. Working in close collaboration with Engineers, Designers, Researchers, Marketers, and Business teams, the Digital Product Manager aligns priorities and drives a software development roadmap that transforms how we do business across our brands.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce, Technical is the ultimate "jack-of-all-trades" leveraging deep customer empathy, strategic thinking, commercial, analytical, technical capability and knowledge, and leadership prowess to successfully deliver delightful and differentiated products that drive growth and positively impact our customers lives across T-Mobile or Metro by T-Mobile. They are the experts at the intersection of the wireless industry and the digital world, creating experiences that are on par with the best in technology.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce is asked to lead the development and optimization of e-commerce experiences across our digital platforms - Web, T-Life, or Metro by T-Mobile prepaid. In this role, you will be responsible for defining product vision, roadmap, and feature requirements to drive online sales, enhance customer journeys, and support business growth. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams—including UX, engineering, marketing, and analytics—to deliver seamless, scalable, and innovative digital solutions. The ideal candidate has a strong background in e-commerce, data-driven decision-making, and agile product development.
Job Responsibilities:

Vision, Strategy, and Analysis
• Owns product end to end for products or features with moderate level of complexity and scope. This includes creating, managing, maintaining, and communicating product vision and roadmap including technical vision and capabilities.
• Drives end user product research.
• Partners with business and internal/external stakeholders to understand current customer experience, identifies areas of opportunity.
• Conducts analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to identify product innovation opportunities or root cause of issues, and assess opportunity size and impact. May work with data scientists to answer complex questions or identify meaningful insights from data.
• Leverages rapid hypothesis driven testing methodologies and experiments (i.e. paper prototype, A/B testing, etc.) to inform direction, prioritize investment.
• Conducts cost-benefit / ROI / NPV analysis, to support decision making.
• Develops and maintains current understanding of tech trends. Assesses how trends impact the roadmap or create opportunity for innovation of the product.
• Communicates, influences, and sells ideas at Director level and below. This includes regularly delivering product presentations.
• Conducts specific ad hoc analysis and provides insights to management on request.
• Recommends product feature set or technical improvements to improve customer experience.
Customer Evangelist
• Leverages customer insights for product vision, strategy, roadmap, priorities.
• Dedicates time to customers actively meeting with them to build deeper empathy and understand their needs
and priorities.
• Evangelizes and advocates for the customer both internally (IC through C level) and externally, perpetuating the customer-first mindset.
• Creates an environment and culture where the team is immersed in customer-first mindset.
Product Execution & Technical Delivery
• Translates product/platform strategy by writing detailed features and user stories consumable for Dev teams for moderately complex products. This work may include creation of prototypes.
• Collaborates with PM and Dev leaders to design, architect and assemble effective Agile delivery teams in the Agile Release Train and Agile Teams.
• Runs or contributes significantly to key Agile ceremonies: Program Increment (PI) Planning / Big Room Planning; System Demo; Inspect and Adapt (I&A), etc.
• Owns and manages product backlog and priorities with our business and technology partners. Backlog at this level typically serves 1 - 4 Agile / Scrum / Sprint teams.
• Scopes and prioritizes activities based on business and customer impact.
• Ensures existing production defects are factored into regular backlog prioritization for resolution based on priority.
• Collaborates with stakeholders and Dev / Execution teams to create and communicate anticipated release schedule.
• Generates and maintains dashboards and reports that track product health and success metrics, technical KPI’s.
• Communicates technical challenges to stakeholders and makes educated trade-off decisions based on those challenges.
• Accountable for product quality and performance in production environment. Accountable for product team response in event of critical or high impacting defect, including communications to stakeholders at all levels.
Relationship & People, Professional Development
• Collaborates and develops positive working relationships with many technical and non-technical teams, including sales, commercial, accounting, marketing, legal, go-to-market, finance, Dev, Architecture, Engineering. Works with outside partners and other third parties.
• Develops positive working relationships with Customer groups or Customer Representatives.
• Maintains professional knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviews professional publications; establishes personal networks; participates in professional societies.
• Develops adoption tools and training material.
• Manages development of adoption tools and training materials for Technical Product Management team. 

Education and Work Experience:

Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Marketing or equivalent experience. (Required) 
3+ years experience in hands on technical writing production code, solution engineering, or technical architecture in large scale company/ application/product environment. (Required)
5+ years of relevant Product Management experience in an agile software product development environment. (Required) 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Agile Methodologies Proven success in delivering software with Agile Scrum methodologies and other commonly used tools. (Required) 
Technical Writing Strong requirements elicitation, and proven writing skills including the ability to write concisely and clearly for different audiences. (Required) 
Agile Project Management Experience with Agile backlog/project management tools. (Required) 
Collaboration Experience with successive elaboration and ability to develop Initiatives, Features and User Stories that the DevOps teams can ingest. (Required) 
Communication Proven ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with Leadership, while employing a high degree of collaboration and influence.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences including executives and non-technical leaders. (Required) 
Business Analysis Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to identify/analyze/synthesize product use data. (Required) 

Licenses and Certifications:

Certified Scrum Master (CSM) Scrum Product Owner Certification (CSPO) (Preferred) 
Other Technical Certification Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) (Preferred)
At least 18 years of age

{"job_description": "PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Digital Product Manager - Commerce
Apply Now
Back to Search
At T-Mobile, we invest in YOU!  Our Total Rewards Package ensures that employees get the same big love we give our customers.  All team members receive a competitive base salary and compensation package - this is Total Rewards. Employees enjoy multiple wealth-building opportunities through our annual stock grant, employee stock purchase plan, 401(k), and access to free, year-round money coaches. That’s how we’re UNSTOPPABLE for our employees!

Are you excited by the opportunity to build the best digital experience as part of T-Mobile’s industry-leading transformation across apps and web? Come help us expand our impact in connecting people to their world—whether through T-Mobile postpaid, Metro by T-Mobile prepaid, or one of our other innovative brands. This is your chance to join a team of hard-working product managers who are making the impossible possible.

The Product Managers at T-Mobile are innovators, strategists, analysts, and customer evangelists who guide digital product development from conception to launch. Working in close collaboration with Engineers, Designers, Researchers, Marketers, and Business teams, the Digital Product Manager aligns priorities and drives a software development roadmap that transforms how we do business across our brands.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce, Technical is the ultimate "jack-of-all-trades" leveraging deep customer empathy, strategic thinking, commercial, analytical, technical capability and knowledge, and leadership prowess to successfully deliver delightful and differentiated products that drive growth and positively impact our customers lives across T-Mobile or Metro by T-Mobile. They are the experts at the intersection of the wireless industry and the digital world, creating experiences that are on par with the best in technology.

The Digital Product Manager Commerce is asked to lead the development and optimization of e-commerce experiences across our digital platforms - Web, T-Life, or Metro by T-Mobile prepaid. In this role, you will be responsible for defining product vision, roadmap, and feature requirements to drive online sales, enhance customer journeys, and support business growth. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams—including UX, engineering, marketing, and analytics—to deliver seamless, scalable, and innovative digital solutions. The ideal candidate has a strong background in e-commerce, data-driven decision-making, and agile product development.
Job Responsibilities:

Vision, Strategy, and Analysis
• Owns product end to end for products or features with moderate level of complexity and scope. This includes creating, managing, maintaining, and communicating product vision and roadmap including technical vision and capabilities.
• Drives end user product research.
• Partners with business and internal/external stakeholders to understand current customer experience, identifies areas of opportunity.
• Conducts analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to identify product innovation opportunities or root cause of issues, and assess opportunity size and impact. May work with data scientists to answer complex questions or identify meaningful insights from data.
• Leverages rapid hypothesis driven testing methodologies and experiments (i.e. paper prototype, A/B testing, etc.) to inform direction, prioritize investment.
• Conducts cost-benefit / ROI / NPV analysis, to support decision making.
• Develops and maintains current understanding of tech trends. Assesses how trends impact the roadmap or create opportunity for innovation of the product.
• Communicates, influences, and sells ideas at Director level and below. This includes regularly delivering product presentations.
• Conducts specific ad hoc analysis and provides insights to management on request.
• Recommends product feature set or technical improvements to improve customer experience.
Customer Evangelist
• Leverages customer insights for product vision, strategy, roadmap, priorities.
• Dedicates time to customers actively meeting with them to build deeper empathy and understand their needs
and priorities.
• Evangelizes and advocates for the customer both internally (IC through C level) and externally, perpetuating the customer-first mindset.
• Creates an environment and culture where the team is immersed in customer-first mindset.
Product Execution & Technical Delivery
• Translates product/platform strategy by writing detailed features and user stories consumable for Dev teams for moderately complex products. This work may include creation of prototypes.
• Collaborates with PM and Dev leaders to design, architect and assemble effective Agile delivery teams in the Agile Release Train and Agile Teams.
• Runs or contributes significantly to key Agile ceremonies: Program Increment (PI) Planning / Big Room Planning; System Demo; Inspect and Adapt (I&A), etc.
• Owns and manages product backlog and priorities with our business and technology partners. Backlog at this level typically serves 1 - 4 Agile / Scrum / Sprint teams.
• Scopes and prioritizes activities based on business and customer impact.
• Ensures existing production defects are factored into regular backlog prioritization for resolution based on priority.
• Collaborates with stakeholders and Dev / Execution teams to create and communicate anticipated release schedule.
• Generates and maintains dashboards and reports that track product health and success metrics, technical KPI’s.
• Communicates technical challenges to stakeholders and makes educated trade-off decisions based on those challenges.
• Accountable for product quality and performance in production environment. Accountable for product team response in event of critical or high impacting defect, including communications to stakeholders at all levels.
Relationship & People, Professional Development
• Collaborates and develops positive working relationships with many technical and non-technical teams, including sales, commercial, accounting, marketing, legal, go-to-market, finance, Dev, Architecture, Engineering. Works with outside partners and other third parties.
• Develops positive working relationships with Customer groups or Customer Representatives.
• Maintains professional knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviews professional publications; establishes personal networks; participates in professional societies.
• Develops adoption tools and training material.
• Manages development of adoption tools and training materials for Technical Product Management team. 

Education and Work Experience:

Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Marketing or equivalent experience. (Required) 
3+ years experience in hands on technical writing production code, solution engineering, or technical architecture in large scale company/ application/product environment. (Required)
5+ years of relevant Product Management experience in an agile software product development environment. (Required) 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Agile Methodologies Proven success in delivering software with Agile Scrum methodologies and other commonly used tools. (Required) 
Technical Writing Strong requirements elicitation, and proven writing skills including the ability to write concisely and clearly for different audiences. (Required) 
Agile Project Management Experience with Agile backlog/project management tools. (Required) 
Collaboration Experience with successive elaboration and ability to develop Initiatives, Features and User Stories that the DevOps teams can ingest. (Required) 
Communication Proven ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with Leadership, while employing a high degree of collaboration and influence.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences including executives and non-technical leaders. (Required) 
Business Analysis Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to identify/analyze/synthesize product use data. (Required) 

Licenses and Certifications:

Certified Scrum Master (CSM) Scrum Product Owner Certification (CSPO) (Preferred) 
Other Technical Certification Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) (Preferred)
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States

Travel:
Travel Required (Yes/No):

DOT Regulated:
DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No): No
Safety Sensitive Position (Yes/No): No

Base Pay Range: $103,400 - $186,400
Corporate Bonus Target: 15%
